p: NO release by infected macrophages was investigated after treatment with essential oils from Nectandra spp. ( Figure 1). The increase in NO release by L. infantum-infected cells after treatment with NHEO did not achieve statistical significance at most of the concentrations tested, showing that this oil probably does not act by this indirect mechanism to control Leishmania infection. Instead, this oil might act directly on the parasites. On the other hand, NHEO induced a significant increase in NO production by L. amazonensis-infected cells, compared to infected control cells. Interestingly, Siqueira etÂ al. ( 2011) demonstrated that the bicyclogermacrene-rich oil from A. coriacea had a direct action on L. infantum and L. amazonensis promastigote forms, what could help elucidate its mechanism of action.
